Really Great Game!

Portal 2 is a monument of video game ingenuity due to its combination of amazingly well designed puzzles and a satisfying story. GlaDOS, powered with a potato battery this time, is still funny and somehow more intimidating while Wheatley your new assistance offers quirky humour and guidance throughout the storys progression. 
The multiplayer portion of this game is also funny and great to play with a friend. It offers up its own short but sweet campaign and a plethora of mind bending puzzles to solve together with a friend.

After not having played this game since its release, I just played through it again, and I have to say it still hold up fantastically today! The writing, acting, and game play are all knocked out of the park, and are still as hilarious as they were back in the day. Can't recommended Portal 2 enough - if you haven't played it - do it! You'll have the time of your life!

Such a classic. Whoever says video games aren't good for the mind have never played this one. A must play for the PC.

I absolutely *adored* the opening. So unique, and Wheatley is such a charming and hilarious character! I really appreciated the expansion of the story from the first game and how much more story-driven it really was. I think the only issue I had with it was that some of the puzzles felt wayyyyy too large (space-wise) so it was a lot to take in and therefore took longer to solve. What I mean by this was that they were not simply hard puzzles, but just having them so spread out when they could have been more compact made them harder in a way that was not enjoyable. 

Also, I feel there were just a few too many puzzles anyway. Maybe it is because I am really big into story-driven games, but I liked Portal 1 just fine, and it didn't have much story at all! The amount of puzzles felt appropriate for what was going on. But sometimes, I found myself wishing it was just over already, which isn't good.

But, overall, I really do ADORE this game. Definitely one of my favorites, and honestly? Really pretty! And I think Wheatley was a fantastically written character, although /strike him turning evil was pretty predictable. /strike Nonetheless, the story was great! I wish there were more games like this one out there!
